God

Gods are an order of divine atman which participated in the creation of, and shaping of creations. The way that gods interect with their creations, and those of others, varies: some remain in the a-temporal space of True Creation, while others enter into Creations, and some of those choose even to craft or otherwise interact with them from within - again in varying ways. Some may choose to ignore their potential and live out ordinary lives amongst other creatures in a world, while others serve as deities and forces of nature. Both internal and external gods are capable of interacting with entities within their Creation; a external god holds more power, but is generally more detached from the reality of its Creation - colder less caring. Due to the a-temporal nature of True Creation, a god may even choose to enter into multiple creations.

The definition of God may also include Soul Stewards who enter into a Creation or take an active interest in its design, including the Charon and Charis.

Entry

Gods may choose to enter a Creation at any time in its own temporal structure, or even to come and go, but such a decision is made prior to first entry, when the god exists outside of the Creation, with a full overview of its form. Many then within a Creation are bound by their own immutable will; some even forget, over time, why they made the decisions they did, and choose to lie dormant until they remember what they were intending to do.

List of Gods

  • Dead Gods
